name: Radisson Blu Hotel Latvija

reviews.text: The hotel itself is 26-storey building from the soviet era, but it was completely renovated in the 90-s, and several times refurbished since when, so you won't even feel any smell of soviet legacy. Location is the best possible in the centre of Riga - all you would like and have to see in the city centre is located within walking distance. Stayed in standard room, but book a superior one and you will be rewarded with a great views of the Old Riga and beautiful orthodox cathedral located in a park just over the street. Try some beer or cocktail in Skyline restaurant/bar located on the 26th floor and you will definitely enjoy your drink while viewing all the beauty of Latvian capital, especially in the evening or during the "Staro Riga" festival, what can be translated as Riga Shines, which take place every year around mid-November! But don't miss a good seat with a view - even during weekdays the place is very busy.

reviews.text: We got a room at the 19th floor, opened the door and it looked fantastic. Modern interior, BIG BED with numerous pillows, straight ironed sheets and soft blankets. A bed worthy a princess or prince. A big television screen strategically placed, room service and a menu with various options. Great view of Old Town Riga and kind service for real (no acting). However, the temperature of the room or the condition of something (such as the air or the humid) made the two nights very uncomfortable... actually we both got trouble falling a sleep, it was two nights with bad sleep, even missed the very lower class hotel we had the nights before. However, the rooms were great for watching television and ordering room service. Anyway, we didn't go to Riga to sleep, so I would actually recommend another hotel or another room or floor if you do fancy a good night sleep in Riga. Would be cheaper too....

reviews.text: The rooms are small and clean. However, it is not great that they charge more for newer, refurbished rooms. Surely all standard rooms should be of a high standard. Essentially you pay more for a redecorated room and less for a tatty one. They also advertise they have a pool and gym etc, the reason why I made a reservation. Consequently, they do not. It is part of their spa which is run by a another company and if you wish to use the pool and gym, it is around 20 euros for the privilege. I pointed this out to the manager, to which he agreed that this should not be promoted in such a way and that he would talk to the marketing team. Will it change? Their marketing appears quite synical and I will not return.
reviews.title: Average and mis-selling

reviews.text: I recently stayed here on Business. Riga is a lovely small city with a wonderful architectural heritage and while the Radisson Latvija is not the most beautiful building - the inside of the hotel does everything very well. Customer service is friendly, efficient and on the mark. If your budget can manage it, it's worth paying an extra 40 euros to upgrade to a "business class" room because it gets you a 40sqm room with separate sitting area, a large bathroom and a bunch of additional amenities incl. breakfast in the room. Free WIFI as standard at Radisson properties and a fantastic location being 5-15 minutes from the centre of the old town.

description: Radisson Blu Hotel Latvija, Riga. Offering the most impressive views over both the Old Town and central Riga, this hotel is famous for its lively atmosphere and wealth of entertainment options including the trendy and stylish Skyline bar with its fabulous city views from the 26th floor and the brand new and conceptually unique ESPA Riga spa facilities. 571 comfortable guestrooms including 197 Standard Class, 332 Superior Class, 38 Business Class rooms, 3 Suites and one luxurious Presidential Suite. Many rooms with charming views of the Old Town. The Esplanade restaurant offering one of the best International cuisine buffets in Riga, alongside its a la carte menu. Urban and trendy Skyline Bar with the best view in the city and D’vine Bar offering tasty tapas and wide selection of wines. ESPA Rīga - an exclusive five star spa facility with luxurious interior design. Modern and multifunctional Conference & Event center featuring 15 rooms including largest meeting room Omega with maximum seating capacity of 1100 delegates. 24 hr casino and Latvija Shopping Arcade. Underground parking (for additional fee). Free WiFi - free wireless Internet access throughout the hotel.
